result.execSummary:
The defendant Glenn Javell Hilliard Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $1000.00 or 50 hours of community service, to be paid by November 20, 2015. 
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, by November 20, 2015 any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
**2/3/2015 Honorable Carolina Maria Stark:  The amount of civil judgment entered against defendant on November 30, 2015 shall be amended from $2,733.00 to $1,733.00 the amount of costs/surcharges.
Also ordered defendant shall satisfy the $1,000.00 fine in full by June 15, 2016 either by provided the Clerk of Courts with proof of completing the 50 hours of community service for nonprofit organization on dates between Feb. 1, 2016 and June 15, 2016, or by paying the amount in full.  Failure to satisy in full by June 15, 2016 shall result in a civil judgment against the defendant for any balance still owed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Glenn Javell Hilliard Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Vacate Judgment in the amount of $2,733.00 per court order. JM

Order Granting Defendant's Request to Extend Deadline for Satisfying Fine, signed and filed. tk
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. mag
Letter on behalf of defendant for attorney Procaccio received and filed. tk
Court order the Confidential Memorandums to be sealed and to remain in the court file. tk

Defendant Glenn Javell Hilliard in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Side bar placed on the record. 
AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Glenn Javell Hilliard in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio. Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
 Defense has not yet received discovery and offer from previous counsel and requests case be adjourned for Scheduling Conference. Case is adjourned for projected plea and sentencing, Branch 17. Any motions are due no later than May 20, 2015 at 8:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Calendar call scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Glenn Javell Hilliard in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For the reasons placed on the record the Court grants the Defense motion to withdraw as counsel. 
Attorney Lisa Procaccio is present in Court and is willing to interview the Defendant to determine qualification for representation by the State Public Defenders Office. Case passed.
Case recalled. Attorney Lisa Procaccio appeared as a friend to the Court.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Procaccio stated the Defendant does qualify for Public Defender representation. Case is adjourned for Status of Counsel on 4-22-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Glenn Javell Hilliard in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Brandon A Wigley for Paul Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record.  Defense counsel requests a plea/sentencing date.  Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Glenn Javell Hilliard in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Ron Dague for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
The Court ordered no use or possession of illegal drugs.

Defendant Glenn Javell Hilliard in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
